description: Writing style patterns: tone, attribution, uncertainty/confidence language, exemplar sentences

voice_and_tone.rule: Use third person passive voice throughout. Maintain analytical distance while presenting findings.

attribution_rules.rule: Use superscript footnotes for all factual claims. Include specific dates and source names.

certainty_calibration.verified_facts_pattern: matter of public record that, approved by MEKH, corporate registry revealed
certainty_calibration.unverified_claims_pattern: generally believed, it is highly likely, according to media accounts, suspected
certainty_calibration.inference_pattern: this suggests, based on available evidence, we note that
certainty_calibration.rule: Always distinguish between verified registry data and unverified media/HUMINT. Use hedging language for inferences and speculation.

structure_rules.paragraph_style: Lead with key finding, provide supporting evidence with specific dates and sources
structure_rules.section_transitions: Use chronological progression with clear date markers for ownership changes
structure_rules.evidence_presentation: Present primary sources (registries, filings) first, then corroborating media and HUMINT

professional_conventions.entity_introduction: Full legal name in quotes, jurisdiction in parentheses, abbreviated name in quotes for subsequent references
professional_conventions.date_formatting: DD Month YYYY format with regulatory context provided
professional_conventions.currency_formatting: €53.02 million format with transaction context
professional_conventions.name_handling: Full name on first mention with role/title, surname only in subsequent references

exemplar_passages.passage: On 17 December 2009, the Hungarian Energy and Public Utility Regulatory Authority (MEKH) approved MOL's sale of 50% of MET Hungary to Normeston Trading Limited ("Normeston") of Belize.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Verified fact presentation with specific date, authority, and transaction details
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Provides precise attribution to regulatory source with exact date and percentage

exemplar_passages.passage: It is generally believed – and is indeed highly likely, based on both historical ownership information and media accounts – that Benjámin Lakatos, MET Group's CEO, holds the largest stake
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Uncertainty calibration for unverified claims
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly signals unverified status while indicating confidence level and evidence basis

voice_and_tone.rule: Use third person throughout. Maintain professional, analytical tone. Present facts objectively without editorial commentary.

attribution_rules.rule: Footnote every factual claim with superscript numbers. Include comprehensive source attribution.

certainty_calibration.verified_facts_pattern: According to the German corporate registry..., Registry records show...
certainty_calibration.unverified_claims_pattern: According to media reports..., It is reported that...
certainty_calibration.inference_pattern: This suggests..., Based on available information...
certainty_calibration.rule: Clearly distinguish between verified official records and unverified media/social media claims. Use hedging language appropriately.

structure_rules.paragraph_style: Lead with key facts, follow with supporting details. Maintain chronological order where relevant.
structure_rules.section_transitions: Use clear section breaks. Each person gets dedicated section with consistent subsection structure.
structure_rules.evidence_presentation: Present official sources first, then media coverage, then social media. Note conflicts explicitly.

professional_conventions.entity_introduction: Provide full name with nickname in parentheses on first mention, use surname thereafter. Include birth details and jurisdiction.
professional_conventions.date_formatting: Use DD Month YYYY format consistently throughout.
professional_conventions.currency_formatting: State in original currency (EUR, USD) with full formatting.
professional_conventions.name_handling: Full legal name on first mention, surname in subsequent references, nicknames in quotes.

exemplar_passages.passage: According to German corporate records and aggregators of global corporate registry data, Sebastian Betz has also had corporate affiliations with About You Open Commerce GmbH, EDITED GmbH, Sebastian Betz Beteiligungsgesellschaft mbH, Creative-Task GmbH, Collins Verwaltugs GmbH and About You Holding GmbH.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Comprehensive source attribution and systematic listing of corporate affiliations
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly attributes information to specific sources and provides complete picture of business network

exemplar_passages.passage: No adverse information pertaining to Sebastian Betz was identified.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Standard disclaimer format for negative information searches
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Provides clear statement of investigation scope and findings in professional language

exemplar_passages.passage: Sebastian Betz ('Betz') was born on 28 August 1990 in Darmstadt, Germany.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Professional entity introduction with nickname convention and key identifiers
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Establishes clear naming convention and provides essential biographical anchors

voice_and_tone.rule: Use third person analytical voice with investigative stance. Maintain professional objectivity while presenting findings.

attribution_rules.rule: Attribute key factual claims and quotes to specific sources. Use bracketed footnote numbers for references.

certainty_calibration.unverified_claims_pattern: widely believed to be... / sources indicate... / according to media reports...
certainty_calibration.inference_pattern: This has led to widespread speculation... / circumstantial evidence indicates...
certainty_calibration.rule: Clearly distinguish between verified facts, reported claims, and analytical inferences using specific hedging language.

structure_rules.paragraph_style: Lead with key finding, follow with supporting evidence and source attribution
structure_rules.section_transitions: Use connecting phrases that link previous findings to new analysis
structure_rules.evidence_presentation: Present strongest evidence first, note contradictions and limitations explicitly

exemplar_passages.passage: Lakatos received his first multi-million dollar stake in MET Group effectively as a gift, and has since become the majority shareholder of the group without any known outside capital contribution of his own. This has led to widespread speculation that he is in fact a proxy acting on behalf of his ex-boss Hernádi
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Certainty calibration and inference presentation
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly presents facts (the gift, lack of known capital) then transitions to speculation with appropriate hedging language

exemplar_passages.passage: According to a source who worked with Lakatos at MOL, Lakatos and Hernádi became close around 2006. Recalling the time when Lakatos worked at MOL's upstream team, the source said he 'impressed' his CEO
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Source attribution and quote presentation
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Properly attributes information to specific source type and provides direct quotes with context

According to the rumours, the Guliyevs hold their stakes in BR on Rustamov's behalf. Our sources confirm that Rustamov is close to the Guliyevs and that he has wielded significant influence over BR in the past (particularly from 2006 to 2017), but they say that the Guliyevs are nonetheless independent actors and that Rustamov's involvement with BR has waned since 2017.

attribution_rules.rule: Use superscript footnote numbers for key factual claims. Include source details in appendix. Distinguish between verified and unverified information.

certainty_calibration.verified_facts_pattern: According to [registry name]... / Registry records confirm that... / [Source] reported...
certainty_calibration.unverified_claims_pattern: According to media reports... / Sources suggest... / It is alleged that...
certainty_calibration.inference_pattern: This suggests... / We believe... / On balance, we find...
certainty_calibration.rule: Always distinguish between verified facts from official sources and unverified claims from media/HUMINT. Use hedging language for analytical conclusions.

structure_rules.paragraph_style: Lead with key finding, follow with supporting evidence. Single topic per paragraph.
structure_rules.section_transitions: Reference previous findings when introducing new sections. Use transitional phrases.
structure_rules.evidence_presentation: Present strongest sources first. Note conflicts between sources explicitly.

professional_conventions.name_handling: Full name on first mention, surname or abbreviation thereafter. Note aliases in parentheses.

voice_and_tone.rule: Avoid the use of passive sentences such as 'measures were taken' or 'a campaign was launched'. Instead, aim for active formulations, specifying which institutions oversaw the design, implementation and evaluation of said policy/measure/activity, as well as the respective time frame.

attribution_rules.rule: Avoid making lengthy quotations of several articles from a legal source. Instead, draft a concise summary of what needs to be conveyed, then add either a footnote or a parenthetical reference to said articles.

certainty_calibration.verified_facts_pattern: Ground sentences in a specific time frame/moment in time
certainty_calibration.unverified_claims_pattern: Avoid words/phrases such as 'currently', 'en la actualidad', 'last month'
certainty_calibration.inference_pattern: Remember that future readers may not always be aware of the publication date of the reports
certainty_calibration.rule: Grounding sentences in a specific time frame/moment in time is always preferable (i.e. avoiding the use of words/phrases such as 'currently', 'en la actualidad', 'last month', etc.)

structure_rules.paragraph_style: The first sentence of each paragraph should be the topic sentence of the paragraph. Then make sure that the rest of the paragraph does not merely repeat what has already been said. The succeeding sentences should either explore subtopics or make more detailed explanations.
structure_rules.section_transitions: Avoid starting paragraphs with simple transition words. If there is a topical connection with the previous paragraph, attempt to merge both paragraphs, or instead replace the transition word with a transition sentence that helps connect the ideas from both paragraphs.
structure_rules.evidence_presentation: For ease of readability, in sentences referencing a legal source, start with the substantive issue and finish with the name of the legal source.

professional_conventions.entity_introduction: The first time a legal source is cited, all the information pertaining to it should be spelled out in full: number, full name and full date (e.g. Legislative Act No. 01 on Migration of 7 April 2021). Afterwards, it is sufficient to reference the legal source by either the name (e.g. Migration Act) or the number and year (e.g. Act 01 of 2021).
professional_conventions.date_formatting: Use full dates with day, month and year
professional_conventions.currency_formatting: Not specified
professional_conventions.name_handling: According to the IOM House Style Manual, the first time an acronym appears in the text, it should be spelled out in full. For MGI reports, acronyms should be spelled out at the beginning of each of the six MGI categories (dimensions).

exemplar_passages.why_effective: Establishes institutional context immediately

exemplar_passages.why_effective: Maintains constructive tone even when discussing gaps

attribution_rules.rule: Use superscript footnote numbers for key factual claims. Reference specific sources for registration data and media mentions.

certainty_calibration.verified_facts_pattern: Registry records confirm that..., According to official filings...
certainty_calibration.unverified_claims_pattern: According to media reports..., It was alleged that..., reportedly...
certainty_calibration.inference_pattern: This suggests..., We assess that..., appears to indicate...
certainty_calibration.rule: Distinguish verified facts from allegations. Use hedging language for media reports and unverified claims.

structure_rules.paragraph_style: Lead with key finding, follow with supporting evidence. One main topic per paragraph.
structure_rules.section_transitions: Clear section headers with summary statements linking to overall risk assessment.
structure_rules.evidence_presentation: Present chronologically within topics. Note conflicts or disputes explicitly.

professional_conventions.entity_introduction: Full legal name with jurisdiction and registration details on first mention.
professional_conventions.date_formatting: DD Month YYYY format consistently used throughout.
professional_conventions.currency_formatting: Local currency with EUR/USD equivalent in parentheses.
professional_conventions.name_handling: Full name on first mention, surname in subsequent references.

exemplar_passages.passage: No significant adverse issues were identified – we assess that Equity Bank Uganda does not present a significant risk.

exemplar_passages.passage: However, Equity Bank Uganda was not convicted or found guilty of any wrongdoing.

structure_rules.paragraph_style: Start with short statement directly answering the question (one line). Follow with expanded justification providing rationale and supporting evidence.

professional_conventions.date_formatting: When citing figures, state the year. For example: 'According to the World Bank's Global Findex database, the percentage increased from 25% in 2011 to 35% in 2014'
professional_conventions.currency_formatting: Include US$ equivalent when citing local currency. For example: 'Capital requirements are A$5m (US$1m)...'
professional_conventions.name_handling: If using name in local language, give translation into English. Check if laws were implemented, not just passed.

He is Sheikh Mohammad's father and if I may say he is a rather peculiar individual, and you know that word "peculiar" would probably make him proud! I think you can probably call him eccentric and very independent minded. But I think perhaps that it is a question of language because what is Sheikh Faisal's is also his son's and Sheikh Mohammad for practical reasons is the UBO as his father is old now and although still active, he is more inclined to indulge his interests than pursue any new business.

attribution_rules.rule: Footnote every factual claim with superscript numbers. Include source name and relevant details.

certainty_calibration.verified_facts_pattern: Data from the corporate registry show that..., SUNAT data also gives..., The database lists...
certainty_calibration.unverified_claims_pattern: according to media reports, it is alleged that
certainty_calibration.inference_pattern: suggesting that, We note that
certainty_calibration.rule: Clearly distinguish between verified registry data and other sources. Use hedging language for inferences and unverified information.

structure_rules.paragraph_style: Lead with factual statement, follow with source attribution and supporting details. One main topic per paragraph.
structure_rules.section_transitions: Use clear section headers and maintain logical flow from identification to activities to risks.
structure_rules.evidence_presentation: Present primary sources (registries) first, then corroborating sources. Explicitly note when information could not be found.

professional_conventions.entity_introduction: On first mention, provide full legal name, incorporation jurisdiction, and registration number in parentheses.
professional_conventions.date_formatting: Use DD Month YYYY format (e.g., '4 June 2015')
professional_conventions.currency_formatting: Not applicable in this report
professional_conventions.name_handling: Use full name on first mention with abbreviation in quotes, then use abbreviation (e.g., 'Hidrocarburos del Mundo S.A.C. ("HdM")', then 'HdM')

exemplar_passages.passage: Data from the corporate registry maintained by the Peruvian Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de Administración Tributaria (SUNAT) show that HdM was incorporated on 4 June 2015 in Lima, Peru, and holds the Registro Único de Contribuyentes (RUC) code 20600427734.[1]
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: verified_facts_pattern and entity_introduction
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly attributes factual information to authoritative source, provides full entity details on first mention, and uses precise date formatting

exemplar_passages.passage: No ownership information is provided by the SUNAT database, and no such information for HdM was identified in other sources online.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: negative_findings_reporting
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Explicitly states what was searched for but not found, indicating thoroughness while managing expectations

voice_and_tone.rule: Use objective third person. Maintain professional analytical tone throughout.

attribution_rules.rule: Footnote factual claims with superscript numbers. Reference appendix source list.

certainty_calibration.unverified_claims_pattern: Sources mention..., Media reports suggest..., It has been rumoured that...
certainty_calibration.inference_pattern: This suggests..., Our research has revealed..., Sources view this as...
certainty_calibration.rule: Distinguish verified registry facts from unverified claims. Use hedging language for media reports and HUMINT.

certainty_calibration.verified_facts_pattern: Registry records confirm that... / Companies House shows that... / According to annual reports...

certainty_calibration.rule: Always distinguish between verified registry data and self-reported information. Use hedging language for unverified claims and inferences.

structure_rules.paragraph_style: Lead with factual claim, follow with source attribution and supporting details. One topic per paragraph.

certainty_calibration.inference_pattern: Flag lack of corroboration, e.g., 'However, we have identified no other sources verifying' or 'However, there is little evidence'
certainty_calibration.rule: Always distinguish between verified registry data and company claims. Explicitly note when corroborating evidence is missing.

structure_rules.paragraph_style: Lead with main finding, support with evidence. Contrast conflicting information within same paragraph.
structure_rules.section_transitions: Build chronologically and thematically from background through current structure to risk assessment
structure_rules.evidence_presentation: Present company claims first, then contrast with registry findings or note absence of corroboration

professional_conventions.entity_introduction: Full legal name in quotes on first mention, followed by jurisdiction and key identifiers in parentheses
professional_conventions.date_formatting: DD Month YYYY format, with context about significance of the date
professional_conventions.currency_formatting: Original currency with USD equivalent in parentheses using historical rates
professional_conventions.name_handling: Full name on first reference, surname or short form thereafter. Note family relationships.

exemplar_passages.passage: The group purports to have been founded in Germany in 2004 and to have expanded into Poland in 2006. However, there is little evidence of the group's existence before 2008.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Certainty calibration - contrasting company claims with investigative findings
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly separates what the company says from what evidence supports, using 'purports' to indicate unverified claims

exemplar_passages.passage: However, we have identified no other sources verifying Vortex's involvement in either project.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Explicit acknowledgment of investigative limitations
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Transparent about what could not be verified rather than simply omitting the information

exemplar_passages.passage: Searches of relevant databases have revealed no evidence that Vortex is subject to any kind of international sanctions or included in any watchlists.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Methodology transparency and negative findings reporting
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly states what was searched and what the absence of findings means

certainty_calibration.rule: Use definitive language for registry-confirmed facts. Use 'informed' or 'sources indicate' for confidential intelligence.

exemplar_passages.passage: Using our sources within the Land Registry we were informed that the subject Alexandros Economidis, with Cyprus ID number 841797, Passport Number E 264567, owns the following property in Cyprus:
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Source attribution with confidential access and systematic subject identification
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Clearly establishes source of information while maintaining confidentiality, and provides full identifying details for verification

exemplar_passages.passage: It should be noted that the Cyprus Company House Registrar does not hold an electronic database in place to help identify directorships and shareholdings like in most European countries. However, we have confidential sources within the Registrar whose searches will reveal whether Alexandros Oikonomides appears to be a Shareholder or Director in any companies in Cyprus.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Methodology transparency with jurisdictional context and source capability explanation
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Explains limitations and capabilities upfront, setting proper expectations while highlighting investigative advantages

voice_and_tone.rule: Use first person plural ('we', 'our') when describing methodology and sources. Maintain formal, professional tone throughout.

attribution_rules.rule: Embed source attribution directly into text. Clearly identify when information comes from confidential sources versus public records.

certainty_calibration.rule: Distinguish between verified official records and less certain sources. Use hedging language for non-official sources.

exemplar_passages.passage: The price for which Dialog was sold varies significantly, depending on the source (USD 500 million, if Wagner's current website is to be believed; USD 330 million, according to a 2016 summary of his career on the website of one of his companies; or USD 250 million plus a USD 25 million investment in his new venture capital vehicle Bright Station, according to Business Insider and the Financial Times's blog, Alphaville.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Handling conflicting sources with explicit attribution and hedging language
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Shows transparency about source conflicts rather than selecting one version, maintains analytical credibility

exemplar_passages.passage: It is not immediately clear when Wagner resigned. He still appears as CEO of Bright Station plc on a June 2000 SEC report. Moreover, when a year later in June 2001, a shareholder general meeting was called to rename Bright Station plc after its most successful subsidiary, Smartlogik, to break with its troubled reputation, Wagner's departure was still reported to be 'imminent' by CityWite.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Acknowledging gaps in available information while providing supporting evidence
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Shows thorough research attempt and provides context for why the information gap exists

styles.filename: Writing sample - Russian Politics essay - Sport and Putin.json

voice_and_tone.rule: Use first person for thesis statements ('I explore', 'I argue'), third person for analysis. Maintain academic objectivity while presenting clear arguments.

attribution_rules.rule: Use author-date format (Author, Year, p.X) for all factual claims. Include page numbers where available. Multiple citations supported with semicolons.

certainty_calibration.verified_facts_pattern: Direct statement with citation, e.g., 'Putin splashed out a reported $50 billion for the Winter Olympics in Sochi (Taylor, 2014)'
certainty_calibration.unverified_claims_pattern: Hedged language, e.g., 'Some scholars argue that' or 'It is suggested that'
certainty_calibration.inference_pattern: Clear analytical language, e.g., 'Therefore, Putin must constantly prove' or 'This shows that'
certainty_calibration.rule: Distinguish between factual claims (with direct citations) and analytical inferences. Use qualifying language for debated points.

structure_rules.paragraph_style: Topic sentence followed by evidence and analysis. Clear logical progression within paragraphs.
structure_rules.section_transitions: Smooth transitions linking previous analysis to new topics, e.g., 'A similar case to the Olympics was served...'
structure_rules.evidence_presentation: Primary sources cited directly, secondary analysis follows. Conflicting evidence acknowledged explicitly.

professional_conventions.entity_introduction: Full name and title on first mention, surname thereafter. Official positions and jurisdictions specified.
professional_conventions.date_formatting: Year only for general references, full dates when specific events discussed.
professional_conventions.currency_formatting: Original currency with descriptive context (e.g., '$50 billion', 'most expensive ever')
professional_conventions.name_handling: Russian names transliterated consistently, official titles preserved in context.

exemplar_passages.passage: Putin's legitimacy does not stem from elections but instead it revolves around Putin's unique leadership qualities. Considering it through the lens of Weberian types of authority, Putin's rule represents legitimate domination based on charismatic grounds (Weber, 1968, p.215).
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Theoretical framework application with precise citation
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Links specific theory to concrete analysis with authoritative source backing

exemplar_passages.passage: However, claiming that Putin uses sport to recreate the Soviet Union is an overstatement – it would imply that Putin mainly focuses on Russians who have an active memory of the USSR.
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Balanced analysis acknowledging counterarguments
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Shows nuanced thinking by rejecting oversimplified explanations while providing logical reasoning

exemplar_passages.passage: Nevertheless, despite the controversies, the Olympics were hailed a great success for both Putin and Russia. Putin himself said one of the main goals was to boost national pride, a successful endeavour in this instance (Walker, 2014).
exemplar_passages.demonstrates: Acknowledgment of complexity followed by evidence-based conclusion
exemplar_passages.why_effective: Balances negative and positive aspects while maintaining analytical objectivity

voice_and_tone.rule: Use third person descriptive voice for factual presentation of subject's background
